SEARCH
Package result

Interface Result<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of value
All Known Implementing Classes:
Result.Err, Result.Ok
public sealed interface Result<T> permits Result.Ok<T>, Result.Err<T>
A result type is a container object much like an Optional, but it can also contain an error. If a value is present, isOk() returns true and the result is an Result.Ok containing the value. The contained value can be accessed with get(). If an error is present, isOk() returns false and the result is an Result.Err containing the error. The error message can be accessed with error(), getErrorMessage() or printErrorMessage(). The contained value or error are guaranteed to be non-null.

Additional methods that depend on the presence or absence of a contained value are provided, such as getOr(Object) or getOr(Function).

Result is primarily intended for use as a method return type for methods that can fail and would traditionally throw an error. This reduces the need for try/catch blocks which leads to cleaner, more readable and maintainable code with better control flow.

Since:
1.2

  • Method Details

    • isOk

      boolean isOk()
      Returns true if the result is Result.Ok, otherwise false if it is an Result.Err.
      Returns:
      true if the result is Result.Ok, otherwise false.

    • isErr

      boolean isErr()
      Returns true if the result is Result.Err, otherwise false if it is an Result.Ok.
      Returns:
      true if the result is Result.Err, otherwise false.

    • get

      T get()
      Returns the contained Result.Ok value. Throws if the value is an Result.Err, with an error message provided by the Result.Err. Only call this method if isOk() returns true.
      Returns:
      the contained Result.Ok value
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the result is an Result.Err

    • getOr

      T getOr(T other)
      If a the result is Result.Ok, returns the value, otherwise returns other.
      Parameters:
      other - the value to be returned, if the result is Result.Err.
      Returns:
      the value if the result is Result.Ok, otherwise other
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if other is null

    • getOr

      T getOr(Function<Throwable,T> function)
      If the result is an Result.Ok, returns the value, otherwise returns the result produced by the supplying function.
      Parameters:
      function - the supplying function that produces a value to be returned
      Returns:
      the value, if present, otherwise the result produced by the supplying function
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the supplying function or the result produced by the supplying function is null

    • error

      Throwable error()
      Returns the error message if the result is an Result.Err.
      Returns:
      the error message if the result is an Result.Err
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the result is an Result.Ok

    • getErrorMessage

      String getErrorMessage()
      Returns the error message if the result is an Result.Err, otherwise throws an exception.
      Returns:
      the error message if the result is an Result.Err
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the result is an Result.Ok

    • printErrorMessage

      void printErrorMessage()
      Prints the error message if the result is an Result.Err.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the result is an Result.Ok

    • on

      Result<T> on(Consumer<T> okConsumer, Consumer<Throwable> errConsumer)
      If the result is an Result.Ok, performs the given action with the value, otherwise performs the given action with the error.
      Parameters:
      okConsumer - the action to be performed, if the result is an Result.Ok
      errConsumer - the action to be performed, if the result is an Result.Err
      Returns:
      the result itself

    • onOk

      Result<T> onOk(Consumer<T> okConsumer)
      If the result is an Result.Ok, performs the given action with the value, otherwise does nothing.
      Parameters:
      okConsumer - the action to be performed, if the result is an Result.Ok
      Returns:
      the result itself

    • onErr

      Result<T> onErr(Consumer<Throwable> errConsumer)
      If the result is an Result.Err, performs the given action with the error, otherwise does nothing.
      Parameters:
      errConsumer - the action to be performed, if the result is an Result.Err
      Returns:
      the result itself

    • map

      <R> Result<R> map(Function<T,Result<R>> okMapper)
      If the result is an Result.Ok, performs the given action with the value, returning a new Result, otherwise does nothing.
      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of the value of the new Result
      Parameters:
      okMapper - the action to be performed, if the result is an Result.Ok
      Returns:
      the mapped result

    • mapOr

      <R> R mapOr(Function<T,R> okMapper, Function<Throwable,R> errMapper)
      If the result is an Result.Ok, performs the given action with the value, otherwise performs the given action with the error.
      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of the value of the new Result
      Parameters:
      okMapper - the action to be performed, if the result is an Result.Ok
      errMapper - the action to be performed, if the result is an Result.Err
      Returns:
      the mapped result

      Type Parameters:

      Returns:
